author: Duna MÃ¡rquez
title: La DANA regresa a Mallorca: alerta naranja de la AEMET y aviso del Govern a la ciudadanÃ­a
text:
Mallorca se encuentra en alerta naranja durante este viernes 1 de noviembre por la DANA (sigla de depresiÃ³n aislada en niveles altos) que ha dejado al menos 155 de fallecidos y decenas de desaparecidos en la provincia de Valencia. El pasado lunes, Manacor viviÃ³ los efectos de este fenÃ³meno meteorolÃ³gico con fuertes precipitaciones que dejaron 174 litros por metro cuadrado que provocaron inundaciones, carreteras cortadas e intervenciones de los Bomberos de Mallorca, una de ellas en la Rafa Nadal Academy. Para este viernes se espera que regrese la DANA. La Agencia Estatal de MeteorologÃ­a ha activado la alerta naranja en toda la isla por precipitaciones acumuladas de 50 litros por metro cuadrado en una hora, llegando a acumularse 120 litros por metro cuadrado en algunas zonas de la isla en pocas horas. Las lluvias se mantendrÃ¡n hasta el sÃ¡bado 2 de noviembre, alargÃ¡ndose el aviso naranja hasta primera hora de la maÃ±ana. Con el avance de las horas la alerta desaparecerÃ¡, pero las precipitaciones se mantendrÃ¡n a lo largo del dÃ­a. Ante la emergencia meteorolÃ³gica para este dÃ­a de Tots Sants, el Govern balear ha reclamado â€œmÃ¡xima prudenciaâ€ a los ciudadanos â€œlas prÃ³ximas horas y dÃ­asâ€ por la alerta naranja decretada. Se recomienda que se tomen precauciones y mantenerse informado de la predicciÃ³n meteorolÃ³gica mÃ¡s actualizada. Las actividades habituales y al aire libre pueden verse alteradas. El Servicio de Emergencias 112 ha activado el Ãndice de Gravedad 1 (IG1) del Plan Meteobal por lluvias y tormentas en Mallorca y Menorca. Para coordinar posibles actuaciones conjuntas, la DirecciÃ³n General de Emergencias ha reunido esta maÃ±ana al Grupo de Soporte TÃ©cnico del Plan con representantes, entre otros, de los Bomberos del Consell de Mallorca, Bomberos de Palma, Cuerpo Nacional de PolicÃ­a, Guardia Civil, AEMET, Carreteras del Consell de Mallorca, Ibanat, SAMU 061, Recursos HÃ­dricos y RiscBal. AsÃ­, ante la posibilidad de que se produzcan inundaciones como consecuencia de las intensas lluvias y dado que este viernes se celebra la festividad de Tost Sants, se han consensuado estas recomendaciones: Planificar las visitas a los cementerios en funciÃ³n de las condiciones meteorolÃ³gicas y extremar las precauciones, prestando especial atenciÃ³n a las personas mÃ¡s vulnerables.
 En el hogar, asegurar puertas y ventanas y quedarse en las zonas altas de la casa. Se aconseja tambiÃ©n retirar del exterior todo lo que pueda ser arrastrado por el agua y trasladar medicamentos, documentos y elementos de valor, asÃ­ como comida y agua potable a los lugares altos de la casa.
 Se recomienda evitar los sÃ³tanos o zonas bajas, como garajes, y desconectar el interruptor general de electricidad en el caso de que el agua ya haya entrado en la casa.
 En el exterior, aconsejan alejarse de torrentes y zonas inundables y, en zona urbana, buscar refugio en un edificio. No se aconseja caminar por zonas con agua en movimiento, ya que, cuanto mÃ¡s rÃ¡pido corre el agua, mÃ¡s peligro hay.
 Hay que evitar los desplazamientos en coche y, si es necesario circular, se debe moderar la velocidad y aumentar la distancia de seguridad. Se tiene que hacer por autopistas, autovÃ­as y carreteras principales. En caso de baja visibilidad, se debe detener el vehÃ­culo y seÃ±alizar su posiciÃ³n.
 No se debe entrar en zonas inundables, aunque parezca que hay poca agua, ya que, con poca altura de agua, los coches flotan y son arrastrados fÃ¡cilmente. Si el coche comienza a flotar y es arrastrado, hay que salir del vehÃ­culo de forma inmediata y, si no se puede por la puerta, se debe hacer por la ventana. En estos casos es recomendable abandonar el vehÃ­culo y dirigirse a zonas mÃ¡s altas en caso de que el coche quede inmovilizado por el agua o que el nivel de agua ya llegue al eje.
 Aconsejan tambiÃ©n llevar el mÃ³vil cargado y suficiente combustible en el vehÃ­culo y no aparcar en puentes, aceras o desembocaduras. En caso de emergencia, hay que llamar al 112.

author: Wanted in Rome
title: Exploring the villages of the Sabina Region north of Rome
text: What to do and where to go in the Sabine hills north of Rome. An area rich in history and culture.Where is Sabina and what is it best known for? For many people who live in Rome it is an area they have heard of but never visited. It starts about 30 km north-east of the city and runs on up the eastern bank of the Tiber for about another 50 km, while extending eastwards from the riverbank into the Apennines of central Italy. Sabine mountainsThe Sabine mountains, rising to 1,282 metres at Monte Tancia, divide the undulating olive groves of lower Sabina from the higher level Rieti plain and the lakes and river valleys of upper Sabina. [website](https://www.lecascatedellemarmore.com/)to find out when the spectacular openings of the [waterfall](https://www.wantedinrome.com/news/water-sports-near-rome.html)take place.St Francis came from Assisi, but he visited and lived for many years near the mediaeval village of Greccio, high above the Rieti plain. Shortly after his death, his followers built a monastery on the cliffs where he slept and where, in 1223, he organised the first ever living nativity play, re-enacting the birth of Jesus at Bethlehem (now twinned with Greccio). [Every year during the Christmas period](https://www.wantedinrome.com/news/italy-assisi-lights-up-basilica-with-giotto-frescoes-for-christmas.html), the play is re-enacted on various evenings by monks and villagers using real cattle and a donkey. The monastery itself has a collection of model nativity scenes, ranging from an igloo to a tent in the Sahara. FarfaLower Sabina boasts an important abbey at Farfa, which is well worth a visit. It dates back to the fifth century and was one of the most important abbeys in Europe in its day. Damaged by fire during the Saracen invasions of the mid-ninth century, it was soon rebuilt.Because of the threat of Saracen invasions, Pope John III issued a papal bull in 966, ordering the fortification of all the property occupied by the nobility in Sabina. This period of castellamento saw walls, gateways, defensive towers and castles built all over Sabina. RoccanticaRoccantica clings to the flank of the Sabine mountains, a dozen kilometres north of the town of Poggio Mirteto. Dominated by its castle, which became a monastery in the 13th century, the village looks out over olive groves and away to the Tiber, with the rugged outline of [Monte Soratte](https://www.wantedinrome.com/news/apocalypse-in-the-soratte-bunker.html)on the horizon. CarnivalsDuring the year, Poggio Mirteto has two carnivals in April, one of which is called the "Liberata", contentiously celebrating the fall of the Papal States in 1861. In May, Selci offers an evening of â€œWine under the Stars", while Configni â€“ located just off the SP313 road from Passo Corese to Terni near the northern Lazio border â€“ holds a wild mushroom and asparagus festival. By Philip Biss Useful web sites Waterfall www.lecascatedellemarmore.com Greccio www.prolocogreccio.it Fara abbey concerts www.abbaziadifarfa.it Roccantica www.roccantica.org Olive oil tours www.johnnymadge.com Walks & youth adventure activities www.cognolorefuge.com Other walks www.ostellomaglianosabina.it and on Facebook Stefano Aperio Bella Horseriding San Lorenzo Agriturismo Pony trekking stefanotigre1988@libero.it Swimming / tennis almalama@libero.it Bicycle hire www.elerent.com Tancia Hostel House www.facebook.com/tanciahostelhouse/ This article was published in the September 2019 edition of Wanted in Rome magazine. author: TargaGTS
title: Comment on Bullet Wounds Found on Bodies of Recovered Israeli Hostages, Confirming Hamas Murdered Them by TargaGTS
text:
Bullet Wounds Found on Bodies of Recovered Israeli Hostages, Confirming Hamas Murdered Them
The Jerusalem Post: â€œSigns of bullets and gunshot wounds were found on the bodies of hostages recovered from the Gaza Strip earlier this week.â€
16 Comments
Bullet wounds were found on the bodies of six hostages recovered by the Israeli military earlier this week. The grim finding confirms the fears that most of them had been murdered by Hamas terrorists during their 10-month-long captivity in Gaza.
â€œThe Israeli army confirmed on Thursday that signs of gunfire were found on the bodies of the six hostages who were recovered on Tuesday from Khan Yunis in the Gaza Strip,â€ the Israeli newspaper
Haaretz reported.
The Israel Defense Forces (IDF) on Monday night extracted the bodies of six hostages from the southern Gaza town of Khan Yunis. The recovery operation in Hamas-infested territory was conducted after the terrorist group
repeatedly rejected President Joe Bidenâ€™s latest ceasefire proposal, demanding more security concessions from Israel.

It is believed that the terrorists guarding the hostages killed them while in captivity, fearing a rescue operation during an IDFâ€¦
[pic.twitter.com/yqbLjPE2X9]
â€” Israel ×™×©×¨××œ (@Israel)
[August 22, 2024]
The bodies of hostages brought back to Israel were identified as those of Yagev Buchshtav, 35, Alex Dancyg, 75, Chaim Peri, 79, Yoram Metzger, 80, Nadav Popplewell, 51, and Avraham Munder, 78.
The mother of hostage Yagev Buchshtab, shared that her son was shot dead in captivity.
Hamas is executing hostages.
[pic.twitter.com/zhoi0GWQgx]
â€” Aviva Klompas (@AvivaKlompas)
[August 22, 2024]
The
Jerusalem Post reported:
Signs of bullets and gunshot wounds were found on the bodies of hostages recovered from the Gaza Strip earlier this week, the IDF confirmed on Thursday.
Preliminary findings were received from Israelâ€™s National Institute of Forensic Medicine, which performed autopsies and examined the bodies of the six hostages, the military stated.
According to the IDF report, marks indicating bullets and wounds were found on the bodies of the six hostages. Additionally, four bodies found next to the hostages in the Gaza Strip were assumed to be terrorists, and when examined, no signs of gunshots were observed. (â€¦)
The Hostages and Missing Families Forum commented on the development, stating, â€œThe presence of bullets in the bodies of the late hostages â€¦ is further proof of the cruelty of the terrorists who held the 109 hostages for already 321 days.â€
The recovery of the bodies lowers the number of hostages still
believed to be in Hamas captivity to 105.
Netanyahu resists Biden demand Israel leave crucial Gaza-Egyptian border area used to supply Hamas
Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu is resisting the pressure from President Joe Biden to give up on key security demands in a bid to reach a ceasefire with the terror group Hamas in Gaza.
President Joe Biden called Prime Minister Netanyahu on Wednesday to press him on the ceasefire deal. Democratic presidential candidate Kamala Harris was also on the line with Biden. â€œVice President Kamala Harris, the Democratic presidential candidate, also joined the call, according to the White House,â€
The Times of Israel noted.
The main sticking points in the negotiations include Israelâ€™s control over the strategic Philadelphi Corridor along the Gaza-Egypt border and continued IDF presence in the enclave to check the movement of Hamas terror fighters. The 9-mile-long Philadelphi Corridor is a major route for smuggling weapons and moving terrorists in and out of the Hamas-held Gaya.
Reuters reported Wednesday:
U.S. President Joe Biden, in a phone call with Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu on Wednesday, stressed the urgent need to conclude a Gaza ceasefire-for-hostages deal and pointed to upcoming Cairo talks as crucial, the White House said. (â€¦)
â€œThe president stressed the urgency of bringing the ceasefire and hostage release deal to closure and discussed upcoming talks in Cairo to remove any remaining obstacles,â€ a White House statement about the call said.
The Israeli prime minister did not confirm the White Houseâ€™s version of the call. â€œNetanyahuâ€™s office would not comment on the conversation,â€ the Israel news website
added.
According to Israeli media reports, Netanyahu is committed to maintaining Israelâ€™s control over the Philadelphia Corridor despite Bidenâ€™s relentless pressure.
The Israeli TV channel
i24NEWS reported:
A political source told i24NEWS on Thursday that â€œPrime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu has not changed his position on the need for Israeli control and presence in the Philadelphia Corridor.â€
This comes after a report in the Washington Post that Netanyahu made concessions on retaining Israeli control over the southern Gaza Strip.
The source said that there will be a partial withdrawal of IDF forces and a re-deployment of the forces along Philadelphi Corridor, remaining in strategic positions and using electronic means above and below ground.
Gazan man says it loud and clear:
â€œWe are the ones who launched this war and we will end it (â€¦) We are the conquerors (â€¦) We will keep sacrificing until all of us are deadâ€
Ceasefire?
[pic.twitter.com/axxaUV61cS]
â€” VisegrÃ¡d 24 (@visegrad24)
[August 22, 2024]
Israel launches â€˜extensiveâ€™ strikes against terror group Hezbollah in southern Lebanon
With Hezbollah escalating rocket and drone attacks on Israel, the IDF on Wednesday night carried out â€˜extensiveâ€™ strikes on terrorist targets across southern Lebanon, Israeli news
reports confirm.
â€œOvernight, the IAF struck Hezbollah terror targets in more than 10 different areas in southern Lebanon,â€ the IDF disclosed Thursday. â€œThe targets included weapons storage facilities, military structures, and a launcher used by the Hezbollah terrorist organization to carry out terror attacks against the State of Israel.â€
Overnight, the IDF says it carried out "extensive" airstrikes against Hezbollah sites in southern Lebanon.
The strikes carried out by fighter jets targeted weapon depots, buildings used by Hezbollah, and a rocket launcher, in ten different areas of southern Lebanon, according toâ€¦

author: RedacciÃ³n/GH
title: Detienen a hombre y decomisan 13 kilos de fentanilo en operativo en Hermosillo | Noticias de Sonora | El Imparcial
text: Detienen a hombre y decomisan 13 kilos de fentanilo en operativo en Hermosillo Tanto la persona detenida como la droga asegurada fueron puestas a disposiciÃ³n del Ministerio PÃºblico Federal para llevar a cabo las investigaciones correspondientes. HERMOSILLO, Sonora.- En un operativo conjunto entre autoridades de los tres niveles de gobierno que conforman la Mesa Estatal de Seguridad en Sonora, se logrÃ³ la detenciÃ³n de un individuo y el decomiso de una importante cantidad de fentanilo en polvo y tabletas, asÃ­ como de vehÃ­culos. Agentes de la PolicÃ­a Federal Ministerial llevaron a cabo la detenciÃ³n de HÃ©ctor Ricardo â€œNâ€, en la carretera 36 norte, con destino a Puerto Libertad, especÃ­ficamente en el kilÃ³metro 49+800, cerca del puente Bacoachi. La acciÃ³n se llevÃ³ a cabo tras una denuncia ciudadana. Durante la inspecciÃ³n de un tracto camiÃ³n de la marca PeÃ±a Motors, se encontraron doce paquetes de polvo blanco con la inscripciÃ³n â€œ55â€³ en un compartimiento oculto en el camarote, debajo de la cama, y una bolsa conteniendo tabletas de color azul detrÃ¡s del tablero de mando. Tanto la persona detenida como la droga asegurada fueron puestas a disposiciÃ³n del Ministerio PÃºblico Federal para llevar a cabo las investigaciones correspondientes. Fentanilo, una droga peligrosa El fentanilo es una droga sintÃ©tica extremadamente potente, cuyo uso inadecuado puede tener consecuencias fatales. El decomiso de esta cantidad significativa de fentanilo representa un golpe importante al narcotrÃ¡fico en la regiÃ³n, de acuerdo con la Mesa Estatal de Seguridad. Este operativo es parte de una serie de acciones continuas para combatir el narcotrÃ¡fico y garantizar la seguridad de la poblaciÃ³n en el estado de Sonora. Las autoridades mantendrÃ¡n su compromiso en esta lucha constante contra el crimen organizado. Se espera que las autoridades continÃºen brindando informaciÃ³n sobre el desarrollo de las investigaciones y cualquier avance relevante relacionado con este caso en particular. Te puede interesar: [Hombre es detenido por mantener relaciones con menor de 14 aÃ±os y grabar videos pornogrÃ¡ficos](https://www.elimparcial.com/son/policiaca/2024/04/25/hombre-es-detenido-por-mantener-relaciones-con-menor-de-14-anos-y-grabar-videos-pornograficos/)

author: DTNEXT Bureau
title: Tiruvarur dist achieves paddy acreage target
text: Tiruvarur dist achieves paddy acreage target Out of the total of 2 lakh ha cultivation, kuruvai was achieved at 70,093 ha while samba was achieved at 75,430 ha and thalady was at 69,353 ha. TIRUCHY: Tiruvarur district has achieved the kuruvai, samba, and thalady cultivation beyond the target, said Collector T Charusree on Thursday. Presiding over the farmers grievances redressal meet, the Tiruvarru Collector Charusree said, the target for kuruvai in 2023-24 was fixed at 36,914 ha while samba and thalady were fixed at 1.53 lakh ha and summer crop cultivation was fixed at 9,742 ha. Out of the total of 2 lakh ha cultivation, kuruvai was achieved at 70,093 ha while samba was achieved at 75,430 ha and thalady was at 69,353 ha. Meanwhile, green gram cultivation was undertaken at 50,000 ha while black gram was cultivated at 36,700 ha during both kharif and rabi seasons. This apart, sesame cultivation was held at 88 ha while peanuts have been cultivated in an area of 84 ha and cotton has been cultivated in an area of 14,000 ha in the district. In the meantime, as many as 41,476 farmers from the district benefitted under the PM Kisan scheme. She asked the farmers to approach the officials of agriculture and horticulture to get clarification with the benefits of the PM Kisan scheme. She said that as many as 3,059 farmers have not yet linked their Aadhar with their bank accounts. It is mandatory to link the Aadhaar for availing the benefits, she stressed.
